summary: The Transformation to Competitive Integrated Employment Act aims to assist employers who use special certificates under section 14(c) of the Fair Labor Standards Act to transition to models that support people with disabilities through competitive integrated employment. The bill provides grants for states and eligible entities, phases out the use of special certificates, and offers technical assistance and evaluation. It also includes provisions for fair wages and reporting. The goal is to improve employment outcomes for people with disabilities, ensuring their involvement in the transformation process and access to integrated services.
